clinical_study.brief_title: Central Line Catheterization With Flexible Tip Straight Guidewire in Small Children
clinical_study.official_title: Central Line Insertion Technique in Small Infants Using Flexible Tip Straight Guidewire and J-tip Guidewire: a Randomized Controlled Trials

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the differences in central venous catheter insertion time, success rate, and complication between the flexible tip straight guidewire and J-tip guidewire for ultrasound-guided central venous catheterization in small children.

primary_outcome.measure: First successful central venous catheterization rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Interval between skin penetration of the needle and installation of the indwelling catheter, an expected average of 3 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first puncture of central vein
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Interval between skin penetration of the needle and flashback of blood, an expected average of 30 seconds
Interval between skin penetration and removal of the needle after guide wire insertion, an expected average of 90 seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: Total time to central venous catheterization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Interval between skin penetration of the needle and installation of the indwelling catheter, an expected average of 3 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of central vein puncture trial
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 times, an expected average observation time of 30 seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of guide wire insertion trial
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 times, an expected average observation time of 90 seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: First successful central vein puncture rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Interval between skin penetration of the needle or angiocatheter and flashback of blood, an expected average of 30 seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: First successful guide wire insertion rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Interval between skin penetration and removal of the needle after guide wire insertion, an expected average of 90 seconds

intervention.description: Use a flexible tip straight guidewire for ultrasound-guided central venous catheterization
Use a J tip straight guidewire for ultrasound-guided central venous catheterization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- surgery under general anesthesia
- require central venous catheterization
Exclusion Criteria:
- central vein anomaly
- hematoma in central vein
- catheterization site infection
